millsfield:images_texts:
Tips for smooth
check-in
Being there is everything. And at
Air New Zealand we want your trip
to get off to a great start with a smooth
check-in. So here are some reminders
to get you on board and away on time.
Allow plenty of time for check-in.
We are constantly looking at ways to ensure we meet our
customers' expectations for on-time departures. To achieve
this. we need the co-ogeration of all travelers to achere to
our boarding policies:
DOMESTIC FLIGHTS.
As part of our commitment to getting our flights away on
time, all travellers must complete check-in procedures a
minimum of 30 minutes prior to departure
This willallow.
you plenty of time for queuing. security screening and making
your way to the gate
To avoid waiting in queues, don't forget to use the
ExpressCheck™ self-service kiosks in Auckland, Wellington,
Christchurch, Nelson and Dunedin.
INTERNATIONAL FLIGHTS.
We would like to remind all travellers that they should be at the
airport 2 ½ hours before an international flight to ensure that
all check-in and passport control formalities are completed in
time to allow an on-time departure
DOMESTIC FLIGHTS CONNECTING TO AN
INTERNATIONAL FLIGHT:
In order o ensure
that we are able to provide you with a
boarding pass for your onward international flight and to allow
your baggage to be checked through to your final destination,
you are required to be at the domestic airport one hour prior
to the departure of your flight.

Tips for smooth
check-in
Remember your baggage limit.
To maintain our current fares, the baggage weight limits
on all flights will be enforced. So if your baggage is
heavier than the allowance, you will be charged for the extra
In most cases the limit is 20kg per fare paying passenger.
CHARGES FOR WEIGHT IN EXCESS OF THE LIMIT ARF:
Domestic flights:
$5 per kg
Tasman/South Pacific flights from: $10 per kg.
Asia flights from:
$25 per kg.
FLYING TO, THROUGH OR FROM NORTH AMERICA?
You are entitled to check in two pieces of luggage, weighing no
more than 32kg per piece. Each piece should be no larger than
158cm (height + width + depth).
Keep cabin baggage under 7kg.
For safety reasons, and for the comfort of all passengers on
board, you may take on board only one piece of cabin baggage
weighing no more than 7kg. It should be able to fit in either the
overhead locker or under the seat in front.
If you exceed this limit you may be asked to check in the extra.
If the additional weight takes you over your checked baggage
limit, there will be a charge
We're getting the builders in.
CHECK NEARLY TO AVOID DELAYS.
Auckland and Christchurch airports are busier than they've
ever been. To make them more comfortable for passengers,
Air New Zealand and the airport companies are making a
number of improvements.
If you are travelling through
these airports it pays to check
in early in case there is any
congestion in the terminal.
21200 Summer Check-in 2004
AIR NEW ZEALAND
A STAR ALLIANCE MEMBER W
2007.005.021
